citations.narrative:
In several of the rabbit enclosures, there was rust present on the wire, resulting in the enclosures no longer being able to
be effectively sanitized or cleaned as required under 3.56. Rust creates a surface that cannot be effectively sanitized
because of the uneven nature and can harbor organisms harmful to the welfare of the animals contained in the enclosure.
This is a 2nd Re-License Inspection for a Class "A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 1 more inspection(s) or by 11 August 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.56(b)(3)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
In several of the rabbit enclosures, there was rust present on the wire, resulting in the enclosures no longer being able to 
be effectively sanitized or cleaned as required under 3.56. Rust creates a surface that cannot be effectively sanitized 
because of the uneven nature and can harbor organisms harmful to the welfare of the animals contained in the enclosure. 
 
This is a 2nd Re-License Inspection for a Class "A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 1 more inspection(s) or by 11 August 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
